issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I tried to click a link on an object details page while I had been logged in to the console for about ten minutes and got a weird error saying this: "This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. AccessDenied Access Denied Could not verify request Access Denied cb25dac1-7f17-4368-b073-4e4d133ece5b " [~dkavanagh] was screen sharing with me at the time and said the token had expired, but as a user I had no idea that this was the problem, nor how to remediate. Can we set the token expiration to longer, please, for one thing, and maybe also get a more descriptive error message (may not be able to do the second one). Relevant code is in buckets.py {code} BUCKET_ITEM_URL_EXPIRES = 300 # {code}
fields.summary: token associated with S3 object details page expires really fast and users don't know what's happening

comments.body: Configurable would be good.
Also, longer than 5 minutes. Should be at least as long as initial session expiration.
let's cc: [~rusvika] since longer durations my be less desirable from a security standpoint.
[~dkavanagh], I need a bit more context here. What functionality are you talking about and why a new set of (short-lived) STS creds is  used?

[~rusvika], this is not STS creds. This is when we generate a signed URL for an S3 object. That URL is available via our bucket support in the console on the object detail page. The URL we generate has an expiration and currently that's 5 minutes, but for UX reasons, that's too short.
[~dkavanagh], why do we need a signed URL? Sorry, it's been a while since I looked at the console, so as much as context as possible would be helpful.
The URL allows users to download objects from the S3 service using their browsers.
Please, discuss the solution with [~rusvika@eucalyptus.com].

[~rusvika]: Please advise what is a good compromise on the download token expiration time for URLs we generated in the console.  I set it for 5 min in the 4.1 release since a user usually won't sit idle on the S3 object details page for more than 5 min to download the object.

/cc [~jloza]
[~kgill], lets discuss it on an arch meeting to see if there are other solutions.

[~kgill], where are these urls (re)generated? My impression from quick testing is that they are generated once on when the bucket content page is visited and then never refreshed. So, perhaps the solution should not extend the expiration time but generate new urls in some circumstances.
[~rusvika]: That's correct, the object download URLs are generated once on page load and are not regenerated.

[~rusvika], [~jloza]: I'm going to allow the object download URL token expiration time to be configurable to address this ticket, and I'd like your input on what the default expiration time should be.  The expiration time is currently hard-coded to 5 minutes, meaning the object's download link expires 5 minutes after the object details page is first loaded.
Did y'all discuss alternate solutions for this in an arch meeting while I was traveling? If not, perhaps we should before going this route.
Yes, lets discuss it.

[~jloza], [~rusvika]: As an FYI, unless the object is explicitly made public, an object's download URL must include an expiration token, which can be valid up to 7 days [1].  Boto's key.generate_url() method requires an 'expires_in' value [2], so we have to set it to *something*.  I'm asking what that something should be as a default, and making that value configurable seems like a good idea.

References:
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17831535/how-to-generate-file-link-without-expiry
[2] http://boto.readthedocs.org/en/latest/ref/s3.html#boto.s3.key.Key.generate_url
[~jloza], sounds good. The link should be https rather than http.
hi [~kgill], thanks for trying to hard on this one. Meta-refresh tag sounds good to me. Same needed for the Open menu item?

[~jloza]: Yep, the meta refresh takes care of the Open menu item as well.  

BTW, we've just about wrapped this up after we address two things...

First, we'll need to update the grantee bubble help text (see my prior comment) since the 'All users' option has been changed.  

Second, could you spec what the lock/unlock icon colors should be based on whether an object URL is private/public?  The are currently set to blue for public and dark grey for private.  The wireframe specs them as yellow-orange for private and blue for public, but I wasn't sure about the yellow-orange since the Actions menu is that color in the wireframe and is blue in our app.

hi [~kgill], awesome, thanks!

colors: as shown in the wireframe, plz. (HP accessible blue for public, a dark yellow-orange with good contrast for the private). If you let me know the variable name for the yellow-orange int he css file I can always adjust the hex value if needed on review. 

For bubble text, please use:
        u"'Authenticated users' requires login credentials and is a more secure option "
        u"than granting access to anyone with the URL. You may also "
        u"directly enter an account ID or a user's email address. If you enter an email "
        u"address, sharing will be extended to all users in their account. "

Implemented in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1511

[~jloza]: We don't have an $hp-yellow-orange color defined in eucavariables.scss, so I set the lock icon color to $hp-orange.  Feel free to change that if needed at eucaconsole/static/sass/pages/bucket_item_details.scss (line 16)

QA Notes for [~ccassler] when verifying this ticket:

We should test the following scenarios...
- When a user sits on the object details page for more than five minutes and clicks the "Open" or "Download" link in the menu item, the open/download action shouldn't return an access denied error from S3/OSG (assuming the session hasn't timed out).
- When an S3 object has been made public, there should be an unlocked (blue) padlock icon next to the link displayed on the detail page.  Otherwise, a locked (orange) icon should display.  Clicking the link should return an Access Denied error (if the item is non-public) since it no longer contains an authentication token query string.
- On the object details page a "Share Private Link" button has been added.  Clicking on the button will open a modal dialog that allows the user to generate a link with a selectable expiration timestamp.  The expiration choices are 5 min, 1 hour, 1 day, and  1 week, with 1 hour as the default choice.  
- When the timestamped link is generated, there should be a loading indicator next to the "Show shareable link" link until the generated link displays in the textarea.  The link should be auto-selected when generated to facilitate a copy-paste operation.
- The S3 sharing panel's "Grantee" field choice for "All users" on the object details page have been changed to "Anyone with the URL"

Nice job, [~kgill]! I pushed a few changes, so you should pull. :)

A few small things:
* on the share private link lightbox, the text box should not display until the Show shareable link is clicked. 
* Also, shouldn't it clear if the dropdown value is changed, so that the user has to click the link again to get a shareable link for the new expiration time?
* dropdown on share private link is missing 30 minutes option
Back to you [~jloza] after implementing your suggested fixes (and further tweaking/fixing the alignment of the Add metadata button for medium/small screens).

Great job, [~kgill]!

I just realized one more thing: Does it make sense to have the Share Private Link button available when the link is public? I don't think so...just the link itself is shareable at that point, right? Let me know...I can update the wireframe to indicate it shouldn't be available and kick the ticket back to you...
GUI-1899 branch updated to display share link button only for non-public items

Awesome job, [~kgill]!

UX review passed, ready for code review.
merged

confirmed that public object links are presented as is and non-public are offered chance to generate sharing link.
